page.title: 03CHANGING TIMES
page.content: Allan Campbell was born in Gullane in 1907 and has lived at 1 Hall Crescent since 1936,he is 78 years old. When he was young he travelled to Edinburgh by train. He went to school in Gullane, the building is now used as a library and play group hall. The bank corner was once occupied by cottages,and there were no houses on Main Street. Middleshot Road was mainly grassy fields with football pitches. Most children were given a shilling a week and some earned more by caddying and doing paper rounds.There were not many clubs only Scouts,Guides,Boys Brigade and football,there was also Sunday School.In 1928 Gullane tennis courts were built and in 1930 new houses were built so Gullane's population increased and everything improved.
